You know who's an awesome frontman? Yes. That guy. But you know who else? James Hetfield of Metallica. The guy has it all. He's a hardass, with a killer voice for metal vocals, and he plays some badass rhythm guitar. He's written some of the best songs the music industry has ever heard, and some they haven't. He's written some masterpieces, and the guy battled alcoholism. I mean, yeah I loved his writing more when he was a drunk, starting fights with his own drummer. But you gotta love the fact that the man took his life in his own hands and fought back at his challenges, and overcame them. So, thanks Mr. Hetfield, for kicking so much god damn ass. Just come back to Montreal dammit.

Sorry for the long ass delay... but Van Halen is back and better than ever!!! Yeah! I saw them in Toronto on July 3rd and all I can say is wow. Well, quick breakdown. I started every "Eddie!" chant, with this other dude next to me. We must have started 8 of them! The show was fucking insane though! Sammy signed a ton of stuff, including two bras, which were given to him by two lucky girls. Eddie's son Wolfgang did not play this time during Eddie's solo. When Ed brought out the powerdrill for Poundcake, I almost crapped myself. I also got Mike's attention and he gave me a little thumbs up. Mikey's bass was the loudest fucking thing I ever heard. During his bass solo, I could feel my eyebrows move. Alex Van Halen is a machine. The man doesn't stop, and his drum solo was insane. He played for no lie, at least 15 minutes non-stop. Finally, we get to Eddie. The man is ripped like Bruce Lee. And can the guy move. He didn't stop moving, running, jumping, falling over the entire night. He even did the 5150 walk! The man is God. The set list included (this is pretty-much the order) Jump Runaround It's About Time Up For Breakfast Humans Being Mike's Solo Somebody Get Me A Doctor Alex's Solo Poundcake When It's Love Unchained Sammy's Solo (Where Eagles Fly/Learning to See) Eddie's Solo Top Of The World The Seventh Seal Why Can't This Be Love Ain't Talkin' 'Bout Love Right Now And For The Encore: You Really Got Me Dreams Panama Oh, and they did a little rundown of the show on MuchMoreMusic with some footage of Jump. And I was in the footage. Booyah Grandpa!
